bill_title: exempt certain trees from requirements related to the removal of vegetation and debris from township road rights-of-way.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to exempt certain trees from requirements related to the removal of vegetation and debris from township road rights-of-way. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 31-31 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The owner of any land abutting or adjoining a township road that is subject to the requirements of § 31-31-2 may request the board of supervisors of the township for an exemption from any of the requirements of § 31-31-2 that may require the cutting, removal, or destruction of any established tree if the trunk of the tree is located not more than six feet inside the outer boundary of the road right-of-way and if the diameter at the trunk is at least six inches. The request shall be made in writing to the board not later than August 1 and shall include a legal description of the land on which the tree is located and a description of the tree. If the board grants the request, the tree is exempted from the requirements of § 31-31-2 for the current year and for future years. However, the board may require the owner to trim portions of the tree if necessary to meet the purposes of § 31-31-2. Section 2. That § 31-18-2 be amended to read as follows: 31-18-2. Every statutory section-line highway shall be sixty-six feet wide and shall be taken equally from each side of the section line, unless changed as provided in this title , but nothing herein contained shall prevent . However, nothing in this section prevents the highway authority charged with the construction, reconstruction, or repair of any public highway along a section line from purchasing or condemning right-of-way for widening the highway to more than sixty-six feet or from purchasing or condemning more right-of-way on one side of the section line than on the other , provided they deem if the highway authority deems it necessary so to do in order to provide a better highway, to avoid destruction of trees or valuable buildings , or to avoid unsuitable terrain. The board of supervisors of a township may reduce the width of the right-of-way of a township road by not more than six feet from the outer boundary of the right-of-way on either side or both sides of the right-of-way in order to prevent the cutting, removal, or destruction pursuant to § 31-31-2 of established trees having a trunk diameter of at least six inches.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
